metadata.label: post
metadata.description: The `Client.post()` function can be used to send HTTP POST requests to HTTP endpoints.

metadata.label: put
metadata.description: The `Client.put()` function can be used to send HTTP PUT requests to HTTP endpoints.

metadata.label: patch
metadata.description: The `Client.patch()` function can be used to send HTTP PATCH requests to HTTP endpoints.

metadata.label: delete
metadata.description: The `Client.delete()` function can be used to send HTTP DELETE requests to HTTP endpoints.

metadata.label: head
metadata.description: The `Client.head()` function can be used to send HTTP HEAD requests to HTTP endpoints.

metadata.label: get
metadata.description: The `Client.get()` function can be used to send HTTP GET requests to HTTP endpoints.

metadata.label: options
metadata.description: The `Client.options()` function can be used to send HTTP OPTIONS requests to HTTP endpoints.

metadata.label: execute
metadata.description: Invokes an HTTP call with the specified HTTP verb.

metadata.label: forward
metadata.description: The `Client.forward()` function can be used to invoke an HTTP call with inbound request's HTTP verb

metadata.label: submit
metadata.description:
Submits an HTTP request to a service with the specified HTTP verb.
The `Client->submit()` function does not give out a `http:Response` as the result.
Rather it returns an `http:HttpFuture` which can be used to do further interactions with the endpoint.

metadata.label: getResponse
metadata.description: This just pass the request to actual network call.

metadata.label: hasPromise
metadata.description: This just pass the request to actual network call.

metadata.label: getNextPromise
metadata.description: This just pass the request to actual network call.

metadata.label: getPromisedResponse
metadata.description: Passes the request to an actual network call.

metadata.label: rejectPromise
metadata.description: This just pass the request to actual network call.

metadata.label: executeWithType
metadata.description:
Executes a GraphQL document and data binds the GraphQL response to a record with data and extensions
which is a subtype of GenericResponse.

metadata.label: execute
metadata.description:
Executes a GraphQL document and data binds the GraphQL response to a record with data, extensions and errors
which is a subtype of GenericResponseWithErrors.

metadata.label: executeSimpleRPC
metadata.description:
Calls when executing a unary gRPC service.
```ballerina
[anydata, map<string|string[]>]|grpc:Error result = grpcClient->executeSimpleRPC("HelloWorld/hello", req, headers);
```

metadata.label: executeServerStreaming
metadata.description:
Calls when executing a server streaming call with a gRPC service.
```ballerina
[stream<anydata, grpc:Error?>, map<string|string[]>]|grpc:Error result = grpcClient->executeServerStreaming("HelloWorld/hello", req, headers);
```

metadata.label: executeClientStreaming
metadata.description:
Calls when executing a client streaming call with a gRPC service.
```ballerina
grpc:StreamingClient|grpc:Error result = grpcClient->executeClientStreaming("HelloWorld/hello", headers);
```

metadata.label: executeBidirectionalStreaming
metadata.description:
Calls when executing a bi-directional streaming call with a gRPC service.
```ballerina
grpc:StreamingClient|grpc:Error result = grpcClient->executeBidirectionalStreaming("HelloWorld/hello", headers);
```

metadata.label: send
metadata.description:
Sends the request message to the server.
```ballerina
grpc:Error? err = sClient->send(message);
```

metadata.label: complete
metadata.description:
Informs the server when the caller has sent all the messages.
```ballerina
grpc:Error? result = sClient->complete();
```

metadata.label: sendError
metadata.description:
Sends an error message to the server.
```ballerina
grpc:Error? result = sClient->sendError(error grpc:AbortedError("Operation aborted"));
```

metadata.label: receive
metadata.description:
Receives server responses in client streaming and bidirectional streaming.
```ballerina
[anydata, map<string|string[]>]|grpc:Error? result = streamingClient->receive();
```

metadata.label: writeTextMessage
metadata.description:
Writes text messages to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the text message to the connection, that message
will be lost.

metadata.label: writeBinaryMessage
metadata.description:
Writes binary data to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the binary message to the connection,
that message will be lost.

metadata.label: ping
metadata.description: Pings the connection. If an error occurs while sending the ping frame to the server, that frame will be lost.

metadata.label: pong
metadata.description:
Sends a pong message to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the pong frame to the connection, that
the frame will be lost.

metadata.label: close
metadata.description: Closes the connection.

metadata.label: readTextMessage
metadata.description: Reads text messages in a synchronous manner.

metadata.label: readBinaryMessage
metadata.description: Reads binary data in a synchronous manner.

metadata.label: readMessage
metadata.description: Reads data from the WebSocket connection.

metadata.label: writeMessage
metadata.description:
Writes messages to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the message to the connection, that message
will be lost.

metadata.label: query
metadata.description:
Executes the query, which may return multiple results.
When processing the stream, make sure to consume all fetched data or close the stream.

metadata.label: queryRow
metadata.description:
Executes the query, which is expected to return at most one row of the result.
If the query does not return any results, `sql:NoRowsError` is returned.

metadata.label: execute
metadata.description: Executes the SQL query. Only the metadata of the execution is returned (not the results from the query).

metadata.label: batchExecute
metadata.description:
Executes an SQL query with multiple sets of parameters in a batch. Only the metadata of the execution is returned (not results from the query).
If one of the commands in the batch fails (except syntax error), the `sql:BatchExecuteError` will be deferred until the remaining commands are completed.

metadata.label: call
metadata.description:
Executes an SQL query, which calls a stored procedure. This may or may not return results.
Once the results are processed, invoke the `close` method on the `sql:ProcedureCallResult`.

metadata.label: append
metadata.description: Append a value to a key.

metadata.label: bitCount
metadata.description: Count set bits in a string.

metadata.label: bitOpAnd
metadata.description: Perform bitwise AND between strings.

metadata.label: bitOpOr
metadata.description: Perform bitwise OR between strings.

metadata.label: bitOpNot
metadata.description: Perform bitwise NOT on a string.

metadata.label: bitOpXor
metadata.description: Perform bitwise XOR between strings.

metadata.label: decr
metadata.description: Decrement integer value of a key by one.

metadata.label: decrBy
metadata.description: Decrement integer value of a key by the given number.

metadata.label: getBit
metadata.description: Returns bit value at offset in the string value stored at key.

metadata.label: getRange
metadata.description: Get substring of string stored at a key.

metadata.label: getSet
metadata.description: Set string value of key and return its existing value.

metadata.label: get
metadata.description: Get value of key.

metadata.label: incr
metadata.description: Increment integer value of a key by one.

metadata.label: incrBy
metadata.description: Increment integer value of key by the given amount.

metadata.label: incrByFloat
metadata.description: Increment integer value of key by the given float.

metadata.label: mGet
metadata.description: Get values of all given keys.

metadata.label: mSet
metadata.description: Set multiple keys to multiple values.

metadata.label: mSetNx
metadata.description: Set multiple keys to multiple values, only if none of the keys exist.

metadata.label: pSetEx
metadata.description: Set value and expiration in milliseconds of a key.

metadata.label: set
metadata.description: Set the value of a key.

metadata.label: setBit
metadata.description: Sets or clears the bit at offset in the string value stored at key.

metadata.label: setEx
metadata.description: Set the value and expiration of a key.

metadata.label: setNx
metadata.description: Set value of a key, only if key does not exist.

metadata.label: setRange
metadata.description: Overwrite part of string at key starting at the specified offset.

metadata.label: strLen
metadata.description: Get length of value stored in a key.

metadata.label: lPush
metadata.description: Prepend one or multiple values to list.

metadata.label: lPop
metadata.description: Remove and get the first element in a list.

metadata.label: lPushX
metadata.description: Prepend one or multiple values to a list, only if the list exists.

metadata.label: bLPop
metadata.description: Remove and get the first element in a list, or block until one is available.

metadata.label: bRPop
metadata.description: Remove and get the last element in a list, or block until one is available.

metadata.label: lIndex
metadata.description: Get an element from list by its index.

metadata.label: lInsert
metadata.description: Insert an element before or after another element in a list.

metadata.label: lLen
metadata.description: Get length of a list.

metadata.label: lRange
metadata.description: Get a range of elements from a list.

metadata.label: lRem
metadata.description: Remove elements from list.

metadata.label: lSet
metadata.description: Set the value of an element in a list by its index.

metadata.label: lTrim
metadata.description: Trim list to the specified range.

metadata.label: rPop
metadata.description: Remove and get the last element in a list.

metadata.label: rPopLPush
metadata.description: Remove the last element in a list, append it to another list and return it.

metadata.label: rPush
metadata.description: Append one or multiple values to a list.

metadata.label: rPushX
metadata.description: Append one or multiple values to a list, only if the list exists.

metadata.label: sAdd
metadata.description: Add one or more members to a set.

metadata.label: sCard
metadata.description: Get the number of members in a set

metadata.label: sDiff
metadata.description: Return set resulting from the difference between the first set and all the successive sets

metadata.label: sDiffStore
metadata.description:
Obtain the set resulting from the difference between the first set and all the successive.
sets and store at the provided destination.

metadata.label: sInter
metadata.description: Return the intersection of the provided sets.

metadata.label: sInterStore
metadata.description: Obtain the intersection of the provided sets and store at the provided destination.

metadata.label: sIsMember
metadata.description: Determine if a given value is a member of a set.

metadata.label: sMembers
metadata.description: Get all members in a set.

metadata.label: sMove
metadata.description: Move a member from one set to another.

metadata.label: sPop
metadata.description: Remove and return a random member from a set.

metadata.label: sRandMember
metadata.description: Get one or multiple random members from a set.

metadata.label: sRem
metadata.description: Remove one or more members from a set.

metadata.label: sUnion
metadata.description: Return the union of multiple sets.

metadata.label: sUnionStore
metadata.description: Return the union of multiple sets.

metadata.label: zAdd
metadata.description: Add one or more members to a sorted set, or update its score if it already exist.

metadata.label: zCard
metadata.description: Get the number of members in a sorted set.

metadata.label: zCount
metadata.description: Count the members in a sorted set with scores within the given range.

metadata.label: zIncrBy
metadata.description: Increment the score of a member in a sorted set.

metadata.label: zInterStore
metadata.description: Intersect multiple sorted sets and store the resulting sorted set in a new key.

metadata.label: zLexCount
metadata.description: Count the members in a sorted set within the given lexicographical range.

metadata.label: zRange
metadata.description: Return a range of members in a sorted set, by index.

metadata.label: zRangeByLex
metadata.description: Return a range of members in a sorted set, by lexicographical range from lowest to highest.

metadata.label: zRevRangeByLex
metadata.description:
Return a range of members in a sorted set, by lexicographical range ordered from highest to
lowest.

metadata.label: zRangeByScore
metadata.description: Return a range of members in a sorted set, by score from lowest to highest.

metadata.label: zRank
metadata.description: Determine index of a member in a sorted set.

metadata.label: zRem
metadata.description: Remove one or more members from a sorted set

metadata.label: zRemRangeByLex
metadata.description: Remove all members in a sorted set between the given lexicographical range.

metadata.label: zRemRangeByRank
metadata.description: Remove all members in a sorted set within the given indices.

metadata.label: zRemRangeByScore
metadata.description: Remove all members in a sorted set within the given scores.

metadata.label: zRevRange
metadata.description: Return a range of members in a sorted set, by index, ordered highest to lowest.

metadata.label: zRevRangeByScore
metadata.description: Return a range of members in a sorted set, by score from highest to lowest.

metadata.label: zRevRank
metadata.description: Determine the index of a member in a sorted set

metadata.label: zScore
metadata.description: Determine the score of a member in a sorted set

metadata.label: zUnionStore
metadata.description: Return the union of multiple sorted sets

metadata.label: hDel
metadata.description: Delete one or more hash fields.

metadata.label: hExists
metadata.description: Determine if a hash field exists.

metadata.label: hGet
metadata.description: Get the value of a hash field.

metadata.label: hGetAll
metadata.description: Get the all values of a hash.

metadata.label: hIncrBy
metadata.description: Increment the integer value of a hash field by the given number.

metadata.label: hIncrByFloat
metadata.description: Increment the float value of a hash field by the given number.

metadata.label: hKeys
metadata.description: Get all the fields in a hash.

metadata.label: hLen
metadata.description: Get the number of fields in a hash.

metadata.label: hMGet
metadata.description: Get the values of all the given hash fields.

metadata.label: hMSet
metadata.description: Set multiple hash fields to multiple values.

metadata.label: hSet
metadata.description: Set the string value of a hash field.

metadata.label: hSetNx
metadata.description: Set the string value of a hash field, only if the field does not exist.

metadata.label: hStrLen
metadata.description: Get the string length of the field value in a hash.

metadata.label: hVals
metadata.description: Get all the values in a hash.

metadata.label: del
metadata.description: Delete one or more keys.

metadata.label: exists
metadata.description: Determine how many keys exist.

metadata.label: expire
metadata.description: Set a key's time to live in seconds.

metadata.label: keys
metadata.description: Find all keys matching the given pattern.

metadata.label: move
metadata.description: Move a key to another database.

metadata.label: persist
metadata.description: Remove the expiration from a key.

metadata.label: pExpire
metadata.description: Set a key's time to live in milliseconds.

metadata.label: pTtl
metadata.description: Get the time to live for a key in milliseconds.

metadata.label: randomKey
metadata.description: Return a random key from the keyspace.

metadata.label: rename
metadata.description: Rename a key.

metadata.label: renameNx
metadata.description: Rename a key, only if the new key does not exist.

metadata.label: sort
metadata.description: Sort elements in a list, set or sorted set.

metadata.label: ttl
metadata.description: Get the time to live for a key.

metadata.label: redisType
metadata.description: Determine the type stored at key.

metadata.label: clusterInfo
metadata.description:
Retrieve information and statistics about the cluster observed by the current node.
This command is exclusively available in cluster mode. If the connection is in a non-clustered mode,
the API will return a `redis:Error`. Other errors will also be appropriately handled.

metadata.label: ping
metadata.description: Ping the server.

metadata.label: auth
metadata.description: Authenticate to the server.

metadata.label: echo
metadata.description: Echo the given string.

metadata.label: query
metadata.description:
Executes the query, which may return multiple results.
When processing the stream, make sure to consume all fetched data or close the stream.

metadata.label: queryRow
metadata.description:
Executes the query, which is expected to return at most one row of the result.
If the query does not return any results, an `sql:NoRowsError` is returned.

metadata.label: execute
metadata.description: Executes the SQL query. Only the metadata of the execution is returned (not the results from the query).

metadata.label: batchExecute
metadata.description:
Executes an SQL query with multiple sets of parameters in a batch. Only the metadata of the execution is
returned (not results from the query). If one of the commands in the batch fails (except syntax error),
the `sql:BatchExecuteError` will be deferred until the remaining commands are completed.

metadata.label: call
metadata.description:
Executes an SQL query, which calls a stored procedure. This may or may not
return results. Once the results are processed, the `close` method on `sql:ProcedureCallResult` must be called.

metadata.label: query
metadata.description:
Executes the query, which may return multiple results.
When processing the stream, make sure to consume all fetched data or close the stream.

metadata.label: queryRow
metadata.description:
Executes the query, which is expected to return at most one row of the result.
If the query does not return any results, an `sql:NoRowsError` is returned.

metadata.label: execute
metadata.description: Executes the SQL query. Only the metadata of the execution is returned (not the results from the query).

metadata.label: batchExecute
metadata.description:
Executes the SQL query with multiple sets of parameters in a batch. Only the metadata of the execution is returned (not results from the query).
If one of the commands in the batch fails, the `sql:BatchExecuteError` will be returned immediately.

metadata.label: call
metadata.description:
Executes an SQL query, which calls a stored procedure. This may or may not
return results. Once the results are processed, the `close` method on `sql:ProcedureCallResult` must be called.

metadata.label: listDatabaseNames
metadata.description: Lists the database names in the MongoDB server.

metadata.label: getDatabase
metadata.description: Retrieves a database from the MongoDB server.

metadata.label: close
metadata.description:
Closes the client.

> **Note:** Use a single client instance for the lifetime of the application and close it when the application is done.

metadata.label: query
metadata.description:
Executes the query, which may return multiple results.
When processing the stream, make sure to consume all fetched data or close the stream.

metadata.label: queryRow
metadata.description:
Executes the query, which is expected to return at most one row of the result.
If the query does not return any results, an `sql:NoRowsError` is returned.

metadata.label: execute
metadata.description: Executes the SQL query. Only the metadata of the execution is returned (not the results from the query).

metadata.label: batchExecute
metadata.description:
Executes the SQL query with multiple sets of parameters in a batch. Only the metadata of the execution is returned (not results from the query).
If one of the commands in the batch fails, the `sql:BatchExecuteError` will be returned immediately.

metadata.label: call
metadata.description:
Executes an SQL query, which calls a stored procedure. This may or may not
return results. Once the results are processed, the `close` method on `sql:ProcedureCallResult` must be called.
